intro: Schizoloma fuligineum, commonly known as the black mold scale, is a parasitic plant belonging to the family Lecanoraceae. It is characterized by its dark, sooty appearance, which is due to the dense covering of microscopic fungal structures. This plant typically grows on the stems of other plants, forming a symbiotic or parasitic relationship. It lacks true leaves and roots, relying entirely on its host for nutrients. Schizoloma fuligineum is often found in humid, shaded environments, contributing to the ecological complexity of its habitat.
